body: Ladylike ruffles have spruced up neutral colors and conservative silhouettes in designers’ spring/summer 2016 collections. At Proenza Schouler, architectural bends grounded a light, gauzy layer that swished and swayed as the model walked. And Simone Rocha’s asymmetrical and artfully arranged ruffles defined womanly curves while the voluminous folds on a J. W. Anderson dress were just sweet — as a peach.
description: Folds of fabric spruce up neutral colors and conservative silhouettes.
title: Three's a Trend: Designers Are Ruffled Up for Spring 2016
